RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 50000. (UP TO $8,700 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANTENNA broke very fast and went straight to the front, showed the way under some pressure to her outside, vied along the rail on the turn, was asked for her best in upper stretch, battled with the runner-up into the final sixteenth and prevailed under strong urging. EXTRA DIRTY was last to commence then had her path taken, tracked the pace on the outside, made a bid in the four then three path on the turn, fought outside the winner under a drive into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while clear for the place. BY THE GLASS moved in while settling off the pace, passed the nine-sixteenths under urging, angled from the rail to the three path on the turn, pursued the top two in the stretch and lacked the needed kick while able to get the show. CELESTIAL EXPRESS was fanned out early, settled on the far outside, came under urging near the seven-sixteenths, went four to five wide on the turn and also lacked the needed kick. UNION BELLE climbed early then settled at the rear, went around the turn in the two path and failed to threaten. DAISY'S ANGEL was fanned out early, settled off the pace, was urged along late on the backstretch, went three wide on the turn and came up empty. ALTHENA was carried out early, pressed the pace on the outside, vied three then two wide on the turn, dropped back late on that bend and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Antenna
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Barber Gary
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk fast,drift out early,pace,ins turn,respond,fought foe,prevail

ENTRY.NAME: By the Glass
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved in,well placed,ins-3path turn,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Extra Dirty
ENTRY.OWNER: ERJ Racing LLC Madaket Stables LLC and Kenney Dave
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,mvd up,trckd out,bid 4-3p turn,vied out winner,outfnshd

ENTRY.NAME: Celestial Express
ENTRY.COMMENT: fanned out early,settled outside,ask 4-5wide turn,no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Sands Point S. - Grade2 BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 2 1 1/8M Turf CR: 101. Stakes Purse 200000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ETERNAL HOPE (IRE) was taken in hand early, raced in the three path on the first turn, was rated off the pace, brushed with a rival leaving the backstretch, came under encouragement in the two path on the far turn, shifted three wide into the stretch, gained to make a bid between horses at the three-sixteenths, dueled with the runner-up in the final furlong and prevailed under strong urging. NEECIE MARIE was hustled from the gate, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled on the outside without the benefit of cover, brushed with a foe leaving the backstretch, chased three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch, made an outside bid at the three-sixteenths, dueled with the winner in the final furlong and missed but was clear for the place. HIGHLAND GRACE angled in at the rear early, saved ground while unhurried at the back, was roused on the far turn, remained near the inside in the stretch and finished with good energy for the show. ALPHA BELLA was hustled from the gate, went three wide on the first turn, settled on the outside but with some cover, was roused three wide on the far turn then came four wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. ROOT CAUSE tossed her head under restraint after leaving the chute, moved in before the first turn, was reserved on the inside, came under urging near the five-sixteenths and failed to rally. QUARREL established a forward position early, raced in the three path on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, took the lead near the seven-sixteenths, vied in the two path on the far turn, lost the advantage in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. BE YOUR BEST (IRE) was taken in hand early, saved ground on the first turn, was rated off the pace, came under urging in the two path on the far turn, spun three wide into the stretch then moved further out and also failed to rally. LEAVE NO TRACE broke out at the start, moved up to get the lead, traveled around the first turn in the two path, showed the way down the backstretch, lost the lead near the seven-sixteenths, vied inside on the far turn, dropped back under a drive in upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Root Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: toss head early,mvd in,reserved,saved ground,no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 101. Claiming Purse 42000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At T ime Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SAINT SELBY pressed the pace on the inside, vied along the rail early on the turn, dropped back at the three-eighths pole, angled three then four wide shortly thereafter, gained to take the lead in upper stretch then kicked clear, remained clear into the final sixteenth and just held while shortening stride. CHARLIE FIVE O settled off the pace, saved ground on the turn, angled out while gaining into upper stretch, pursued the winner into the final sixteenth, closed fast on that foe late and just missed while well clear for the place. GANDY DANCING dropped back under urging then moved out, was urged along on the outside, went five wide on the turn and narrowly earned the show. F F ROCKET was urged along off the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, drifted out some in the vicinity of the furlong marker and just missed the show. CHATEAU showed speed on the outside of a rival, vied in the two path on the turn, moved clear at the three-eighths, lost the advantage to the winner in upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Saint Selby
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie Five O
ENTRY.OWNER: Red Storm Stable Flower Power Stables and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside turn, angled out 3/16, chased, gained, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Gandy Dancing
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back,mvd out,urged outside,5w turn,earned show

ENTRY.NAME: F F Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along, 3-4wide turn, drifted out some 1/8, missed show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Floral Park S. BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 96. Stakes Purse 125000. OUTER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $125 each which should accompany the nomination: $625 to pass the entry box and a n additional $625 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Three year olds, 122 lbs. Older 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstakes on the turf in 2023, allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake other t han state-bred on the turf in 2023 or two races on the turf other than maiden, claiming, starter or state-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfe
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCOTISH STAR (ARG) was hustled from the gate, angled out near the five-eighths pole, was urged along on the outside, raced in the four path on the turn, gained five wide into the stretch, took the lead inside the three-sixteenths, battled with the runner-up into the final sixteenth and prevailed under strong urging. RISK FREE hit the outside of the gate and was off a bit slow then dropped back, was urged at the rear, went around the turn in the two path, gained three wide into the stretch, made a bid between horses inside the three-sixteenths, fought with the winner into the final sixteenth and was outfinished. SALVAJE was hustled from the start, pressed the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. SHOSHANAH was coaxed to the front, set the pace under heavy pressure to her outside, vied in the two path on the turn, lost the advantage in upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Scotish Star (ARG)
ENTRY.OWNER: La Providencia LLC and LNJ Foxwoods

ENTRY.NAME: Shoshanah
ENTRY.OWNER: Hallman Suanne and Horlacher Kyle M
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed to front,set pressured pace,2p turn,headed ins3/16,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Risk Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,step slow,drop back,2p turn,3p1/4,bid btwn ins3/16,missd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race wil l be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PURLOIN moved out early then angled back in leaving the chute, settled at the rear, went around the turn in the two path, was asked near the five-sixteenths, rallied to make a bid inside of two opponents in upper stretch, responded well in the final furlong and proved best under good handling. JUST MUSIC was hustled from the gate, moved out then advanced to press the pace on the outside, vied in the three path on the turn, took the lead outside the quarter-pole, was put to drive in upper stretch, battled with two foes into the final furlong, fought with the winner into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while able to get second. WYNNING TOUCH tracked the pace on the outside, made a bid in the four path under urging on the turn, battled outside of two foes into the final furlong and was out-kicked. PHILLY'S FINEST moved in while going to the front, showed the way with some company to her outside, vied along the rail on the turn, was asked under threat late on that bend, lost the advantage outside the quarter-pole and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Philly's Finest
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC and Donarra Thoroughbreds LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 95. Claiming Purse 55000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At T ime Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POPPY'S PRIDE broke out at the start, showed speed while in hand, set the pace with company to his outside, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked in the three path into upper stretch, responded well when put to the crop outside the furlong marker and held while drifting out some in the drive. TWO THIRTY FIVE was well placed just off the pace, angled from the two path to the four path on the turn, drifted out some while pursuing the winner in the stretch and finished willingly for the place. ALLABOUTTHEMONEY was hustled from the gate then coaxed along on the outside, went four wide on the turn, was driven five into the stretch, gained in the final furlong, needed some extra right-rein pressure in the vicinity of the sixteenth-pole and got up for the show. BEACHWALKER was urged along at the rear, rounded most the turn in the two path, shifted three then four wide late on that bend, swung six wide into upper stretch and improved position with late energy but missed the show. RYAN'S CAT settled off the pace, saved ground under urging on the turn and failed to rally. CHARGING AERO was urged along off the pace, went two to three wide on the turn and came up empty. QUICKFLASH was hustled from the gate, pressed the pace on the outside, vied in the three path on the turn and tired. LIFE AND LIGHT broke a step slow, settled near the back, angled out around the nine-sixteenths, went five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Ryan's Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside turn, failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Poppy's Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,pace in hand,2p turn,ask 3p into upper,responded,held

ENTRY.NAME: Life and Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,angled out 4-1/2,5w turn,6w1/4,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Two Thirty Five
ENTRY.OWNER: PlayingTheField Racing Final Turn Racing Stable LLC and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,2-4path turn,chased,drifted out,willingly for place

ENTRY.NAME: Quickflash
ENTRY.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Beachwalker
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,mostly 2p turn,6wide into lane,improved,missed show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 95. Claiming Purse 41000. OUTER TURF (UP TO $7,134 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SKI PATROL was hustled from the start, showed speed while off the inside, moved in late on the backstretch, dropped back along the rail with three furlongs to run, was driven four wide into upper stretch, gained to make a bid just inside the furlong marker and got up in the final sixteenth to prevail. THREE ZERO was hustled from the gate, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the turn, went clear with three furlongs to run, was asked for his best in the three path into upper stretch, led under a drive to the sixteenth-pole then was caught while clear for the place. BLUE PLATE SPECIAL broke a step slow, settled on the far outside, was urged four wide on the turn, came eight wide into upper stretch and finished willingly to just get the show. HATCH was urged early then tracked the pace, went three wide on the turn, spun five wide into upper stretch, remained on his inside lead in the drive and just missed the show. MOON WATCH (IRE) was urged along off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the turn, came seven wide into upper stretch and lacked the needed response. BUILT TO LAST bumped solidly with a foe at the start, settled on the inside of an opponent, dropped back three to four wide on the turn, came eight wide into upper stretch and failed to threaten. FLASH KISS bumped solidly with a rival at the start, settled off the pace, was urged along in the two path on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Watch (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,2-4path turn,7w into upper stretch,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Built to Last
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd solidly brk,ins foe,3-4w turn,8w3/16,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Plate Special
ENTRY.OWNER: Rideau Racers LLC and Rice Linda
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,outside,4w turn,8wide 3/16,willingly for show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 99. Claiming Purse 78000. (UP TO $13,572 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $50,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $40,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% After care Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JEMOGRAPHY chased the pace, saved ground on the turn, inched off the rail outside the quarter-pole, was driven three wide into the stretch, pursued the leader while inside of foe into the final furlong, made a bid between horses outside the sixteenth-pole and got up to prevail. THINKABOUTIT settled off the pace, saved ground on the turn, gained under a drive into the final furlong, made a bid into the final sixteenth but missed while just able to get the place. EMERALD FOREST was hustled from the gate, chased the pace down the backstretch, went three wide on the turn, came four wide into the stretch, pursued the leader while outside into the final furlong, made a bid outside the sixteenth-pole, fought with multiple foes to the finish and just missed the place while able to get the show. MILTON THE MONSTER settled at the rear, went two then three wide on the turn, paused ever so briefly when a foe fell outside the quarter-pole then was roused for more, chased into the final furlong, gained to make a bid in tight quarters between foes late and just missed the show. INTO THE SUNRISE was hustled to the front, showed the way with a clear advantage, went around the turn in the two path, was asked for his best in upper stretch, led to the sixteenth-pole but was caught. ROYAL TRYST dropped back between foes after the start, fell well behind the rest of the field, saved ground on the turn and was no factor. DOT'S DOLLAR brushed with a foe just after the start, settled off the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, passed the five-sixteenths in good striking position, checked sharply when a foe in front fell outside the quarter-pole, was taken wide into upper stretch then eased but walked off. JAKE ROCKS brushed with a foe just after the break, chased the pace on the outside then four wide on the turn, stumbled outside the quarter-pole and fell then was caught by the outrider passed the wire and returned to be unsaddled before being vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Jemography
ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S Imperio Michael Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,ins turn,2p out1/4,3p into lane,bid btwn1/16,up

ENTRY.NAME: Milton the Monster
ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S and Maher Teresa M
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled at rear,2-3path turn,gain final1/8,bid btwn late,miss tri

ENTRY.NAME: Thinkaboutit
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables and Acqua Nova Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Emerald Forest
ENTRY.OWNER: Krakow Racing LLC and Five Horsemen Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Tryst
ENTRY.COMMENT: well behind, inside turn, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Jake Rocks
ENTRY.OWNER: FIN Stables and Sal-Lou J G Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 106. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 105000. (UP TO $18,270 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON $60,000 IN 2023 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRIC E OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COWAN was coaxed along off the pace, moved up outside the half-mile pole, saved ground on the turn, gained under a drive to make a bid in upper stretch, responded gamely in the final furlong, battled with the runner-up to the finish and narrowly prevailed. DURANTE was hustled from the start, contested the pace on the outside then in the path on turn, battled with multiple foes under a drive in the stretch, fought with the winner to the finish and just missed. GUN IT dropped back at the start then settled at the rear, went around most the turn in the two path while unasked then dropped closer to the rail, was roused into upper stretch, gained while remaining on his inside lead in the drive and got up for the show. SWILL pressed the pace on the outside, vied in the four path on the turn, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, dropped back into the final sixteenth and weakened. SCARAMOUCHE was urged along on the outside, went five wide on the turn, was driven six wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick. STROBE was hustled from the gate, disputed the pace on the inside of a rival, vied in the two path on the turn, battled under a drive into the final furlong and tired. PROVOCATEUR was urged off the pace, dropped back while climbing a touch outside the half-mile pole, went three to four wide on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. SEVEN NATION ARMY was urged along off the pace, went four wide on the turn and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Swill
ENTRY.OWNER: Kueber Racing LLC and Ten Strike Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed outside,vied 4path trn,even into upper,drop back1/16,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Nation Army
ENTRY.OWNER: Baker Charlton and Happy Face Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Provocateur
ENTRY.OWNER: McMahon Joseph G McMahon Anne and McMahon Michael J

ENTRY.NAME: Scaramouche
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged outside,5wide turn,6w into lane,lacked needed kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT AT THE BIG A RACE 10 1M Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 75000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track.) (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINE RESPONSIBLY angled in while going to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied in the two path on the turn, responded well when set down in upper stretch, had the rider lose his crop in the vicinity of the sixteenth-pole and maintained a safe advantage under a strong hand-ride to the the finish. ALBEDO settled well back in the field, was taken in hand behind horses near the five-eighths, passed foes while five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch,remained on his inside lead in the drive and finished with good energy for the place. ERIC FROM MIAMI tracked the pace on the outside, made a bid under urging in the four path on the turn, lost touch with the leader in upper stretch, kept on in the final furlong but lost the place while clear for the show. BROWN DON'T STOP settled off the pace, moved from the two path to the four path on the turn, came five wide into the stretch, remained on his inside lead in the drive and lacked the needed response. SOLO RYE'D settled off the pace, was urged while inside to the two path on the turn and failed to rally. KING FREUD bumped hard with a rival at the start, was urged along towards the front, went three wide on the turn and came up empty. HARD PAR stumbled badly at the start then bumped with a foe, went four wide on the turn and was no factor. SWEET TONE bumped with a rival at the start then was hustled, was taken in hand inside the seven-eighths pole, dropped back while climbing some inside the three-quarter pole, went three wide on the turn and had nothing left. SPECIALAGENTJONSON steadied inside the seven-eighths pole, moved from three to five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to respond. JHIRSCH was ridden along while well off the pace, moved from four to six wide on the turn and failed to threaten. UNAUDITED was urged along towards the front, chased inside on the turn and capitulated. KILKERRAN bumped soundly with an opponent at the start then dropped back, saved ground on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Solo Rye'd
ENTRY.OWNER: Bourbon Lane Stable (J Hill M McMahon) Empire Equines LLC Seidman Stables LLC Am
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, urged rail-2path turn, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Unaudited
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along, chased inside turn, capitulated

ENTRY.NAME: Albedo
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back,in hand behind foes5/8,5w turn,6w1/4,good energy

ENTRY.NAME: Brown Don't Stop
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace,2-4path turn,5w1/4,left lead lane,flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: King Freud
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Rudy R and Witz Frank

ENTRY.NAME: Specialagentjonson
ENTRY.OWNER: D'Amato Frank Barraclough Kathy L and Leonard Jr Victor F

ENTRY.NAME: Hard Par
ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club Dark Horse Racing Stable MacWilliams Patrick O and Cutair Ra
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled badly brk,bmpd,well back,4w t urn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Wine Responsibly
ENTRY.OWNER: Broman Sr Chester and Broman Mary
